params.description: The character set to use, if any.

getRenameDatabase.name: getRenameDatabase
getRenameDatabase.summary: Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.
getRenameDatabase.description: This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.

description_parts.content: This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.

arguments.name: oldName
arguments.description: ame The current name of the database.

arguments.name: newName
arguments.description: ame The new name for the database.

doc.description:
Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.
This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.

params.name: $old
params.description: ame The current name of the database.

params.name: $new
params.description: ame The new name for the database.

doc.return: The SQL statement to rename the database, or an empty string if the names are invalid.

getRenameDatabase.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.
   * This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.
   * @param string $oldName The current name of the database.
   * @param string $newName The new name for the database.
   * @return string The SQL statement to rename the database, or an empty string if the names are invalid.
   */

getAnalyzeDatabase.name: getAnalyzeDatabase
getAnalyzeDatabase.summary: Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
getAnalyzeDatabase.description: This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.

description_parts.content: This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.

doc.description:
Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.
doc.return: The SQL statement to analyze the database, or an empty string if there are no tables.

getAnalyzeDatabase.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
   * This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.
   * @return string The SQL statement to analyze the database, or an empty string if there are no tables.
   */

getDuplicateTable.name: getDuplicateTable
getDuplicateTable.summary: Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
getDuplicateTable.description: This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.

description_parts.content: This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The name of the source table.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The name of the target table.

arguments.name: withData
arguments.description: ata Whether to include data in the duplication.

doc.description:
Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.

params.name: $source
params.description: The name of the source table.

params.name: $target
params.description: The name of the target table.

params.name: $with
params.description: ata Whether to include data in the duplication.

doc.return: The SQL statement to duplicate the table, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.

getDuplicateTable.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
   * This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.
   * @param string $source The name of the source table.
   * @param string $target The name of the target table.
   * @param bool $withData Whether to include data in the duplication.
   * @return string The SQL statement to duplicate the table, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.
   */
